poem:
Title: "The Echo Chamber"

In the global circus of politics,  
a dark dance with shadows thick.  
Fact as chaff, fictions stick,  
an illusion's lethal trick.  
Hunter, hounded by barbed prick -  
of father's fame he is the wick.  
Under the weight of verdicts brick,  
Truth stumbles, the clock slows its tick.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Republicans push conspiracy theories after Hunter Biden verdict: ‘A fake trial’ Republicans responded to Hunter Biden’s conviction on Tuesday of lying about his drug use to buy a gun by doubling down on conspiracy theories that many senior party figures have been using to try and damage his president father. Despite the fact that Joe Biden’s son could now face a hefty jail sentence, Donald Trump’s election campaign and its surrogates repeated unfounded attack lines". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
